We store images, icons and application d: We store images, icons and application data in your browser to improve performance and load times.
We use a service called Mixpanel to unde: We use a service called Mixpanel to understand how people like you use Hylo. Your identity is anonymized but your behavior is recorded so that we can make improvements to Hylo based on how people are using it.
We use cookies to help understand whethe: We use cookies to help understand whether you are logged in and to understand your preferences and where you are in Hylo.

actionsTermHelp: The default name of the activity that people complete in order to progress forward in the course, project or module. e.g. task, step, module, lesson, exercise, assignment, drill, activity, mission, practice. Anywhere the word Action would be used will be replaced with this term.
addCustomViewDescription: External links, collections of posts, and dynamic queries
adminResponsibilitiesCustomHelpText: These can be used to denote group responsibilities that members hold outside of Hylo and in real life, like managing equipment, gardens, or childcare. When you add a new responsibility, you can assign that power to specific roles which members of your community can step into.
adminResponsibilitiesHelpText: Stewarding a group comes with responsibilities. These ones are built into Hylo and give access to specific functionality related to the platform. They are associated with the Common Roles that all groups start with. By distributing these tasks into separate responsibilities, we can divide the work and make sure responsible people have access to the powers they need.
adminRolesHelpText: Common roles are shared across all Hylo groups and give access to important platform responsibilities.
are you sure you want to remove {{name}}: are you sure you want to remove {{name}}?
blockConfirmMessage:
Are you sure you want to block this member? 
 You will no longer see this member's activity 
 and they won't see yours. 

 You can unblock this member at any time. Go to Settings > Blocked Users.
clickthroughExplainer: This post may not align with group or platform agreements.
commonsExplainerText1: The Commons are the public stream of content, public group directory and the public map of Hylo.
commonsExplainerText2: To avoid spam and misaligned content, groups must apply for permission to post to public areas. Once approved, your group stewards become responsible for all public content shared that are associated with your group/s
containerWidgetSescription: This is a simple container for other things. Add it to the menu and drag other widgets into it
end_date (optional): e.g. 20200731-12:23: end_date (optional): e.g. 20200731-12:23:12.000+00 (other date formats may work)
flaggingExplainer: Reporting a post will blur it for all group members. Members will be able to see the report and its details. Moderators can clear reports or take other actions if necessary.
flagsNeedACategory: All reports need to be linked to at least one agreement (group or platform)
groupAgreementsDescription: Group agreements shape the culture of your group by helping people to understand what's normal and acceptable. Agreements are presented to members when they are joining a group, and for people who already joined but have yet to agree to a new agreement. People are not able to join a group or see content within a group if they have not agreed to all agreements.
groupAgreementsWarning: When you change your agreements, every member of the group will be notified and asked to re-accept the changed agreements. So be sure you have made all the important changes needed before Saving.
groupParentGroupHelpText: You may add parent groups if you are an Administrator of the group you wish to add, or if the group you wish to add has the Open access setting which allows any group to join it
have a valid emoji and name to be update: A role must have a valid emoji and name to be updated
homeChatWelcomeDescription: This is your home -- the place where the members of {{group_name}} will come together to connect and chat.
image_urls: 1 or more image URLs separat: image_urls: 1 or more image URLs separated by spaces and/or commas
is only accessible to members of: is only accessible to members of
murmurationsDescription: Your group is now published to the Murmurations directory. You can find your profile <1>here</1>.
murmurationsHeader: Add your group to the <1>Murmurations</1> directory so it can be found and easily added to third-party public maps. You must first set visibility to Public.
new comments on posts you're following?: new comments on posts you're following?
newHyloMessage: We just launched a major redesign of Hylo! To learn more about what's new, <1>click here</1>.
only members of those groups will be abl: only members of those groups will be able to join this group. Because of these settings, people who find your group will not be able to see the prerequisite group.
postCompletionActions.button.instruction: Click the button to mark the {{actionDescriptor}} as complete.
postCompletionActions.comment.instructio: Leave a comment on this {{actionDescriptor}} to indicate you've completed it. Your comment will be visible to all members of the track.
postCompletionActions.reaction.instructi: React to this {{actionDescriptor}} to indicate you've completed it.
postCompletionActions.selectMultiple.ins: Select one or more options to indicate you've completed the {{actionDescriptor}}.
postCompletionActions.selectOne.instruct: Select an option to indicate you've completed the {{actionDescriptor}}.
postCompletionActions.text: Respond to a question or prompt
postCompletionActions.text.instructions: Respond to the prompt to completed the {{actionDescriptor}}.
postCompletionActions.uploadFile.instruc: Upload an attachment to indicate you've completed the {{actionDescriptor}}.
purposeHelpText: Your purpose statement is a concise summary of why your group exists and what you hope to accomplish. A clear and specific purpose helps align members of your group to coordinate effectively to achieve your goals. Aim for one or two sentences.
quorumExplainer: Quorum is the percentage of members who need to participate in the decision for it to be considered valid
start_date (optional): e.g. 20200730-12:: start_date (optional): e.g. 20200730-12:23:12.000+00 (other date formats may work)
topics: up to 3 topic names separated by: topics: up to 3 topic names separated by spaces and/or commas e.g. food organic
tracksSettingsDescription: Tracks are lists of Actions. This flexible structure allows for everything from courses to task lists that any member can do. Everyone in the group can see a track and choose to enroll in it. Creating and modifying tracks is a responsibility of Stewards with the Manage Tracks Responsibility.
tracksSettingsHeader: Empower your group through structured learning and activities
type: one of discussion, request, offer,: type: one of discussion, request, offer, resource, event, project
useLayoutFlags must be used within a Lay: useLayoutFlags must be used within a LayoutFlagsProvider
visibleInCommonsText: If toggled to Public, this post will be visible in the Commons; the public feed and public map
who you would like ask join questions to: who you would like ask join questions to vet before they enter the group.
you can add them here, and they will app: you can add them here, and they will appear for all members of your group to see and use to tag posts.

{{parentGroup.name}} requires groups to: {{parentGroup.name}} requires groups to answer the following questions before joining
{{pendingInvitations, plural, =1 {You ha: {{pendingInvitations, plural, =1 {You have # pending invitation} other {You have # pending invitations}}}
agreementChunk1: You are warmly invited to be a part of this community! Our invitation to you is to come to the platform and its communities as a contributor and co-creator. We know you have a unique role to play in making this place more enjoyable and more useful for everyone. We ask all Hylo participants to commit to upholding our {{codeOfConductLink}} and {{termsOfUseLink}} by consenting to the Hylo Platform Agreements. We are so happy you are with us on this journey. Welcome to Hylo!
agreementChunk2: I pledge to behave on Hylo in ways that contribute to an open, welcoming, and healthy community, and to support other members in feeling respected and appreciated.
agreementChunk3: I will respect differing viewpoints and experiences, and work to find common ground and shared values with other Hylo members.
agreementChunk4: I commit to learning from every interaction. I will listen to feedback, adapt, and embrace responsibility for mistakes as opportunities for growth.
agreementChunk5: I pledge to share my voice, ideas, and skills in service to my group(s) on Hylo, recognizing that working together leads to better outcomes.
agreementChunk6: If I see an opportunity to improve something on the Hylo platform or within my group, I will take action to make it better.
agreementChunk7: I commit to upholding the {{codeOfConductLink}}, and {{termsOfUseLink}}, and I agree to participate in accountability processes when necessary.
agreementSubtitle: Please review and accept our community agreements to continue
